page.title: 06Churches in Horsmonden
page.content: The Parish Church in Horsmonden is St. Margaret's & is situated 2 miles South of the village. It dates from 1293 & has many fine features including brasses, stained-glass windows, a fine organ & a brass chandelier dated 1703. The tower holds a peal of 8 bells, the newest of which were hung in 1955. The Rector is Rev. Mervyn Smith. All Saints Church was built on the Maidstone Road 1/4 mile North of the village in 1870 but in 1969 it was decided that the village could not support two Anglican churches & All Saints was sold to the Roman Catholics. There is a large Methodist following & their chapel is in Furnace Lane. It originally belonged to the Exclusive Brethren but in 1964 was bought by the Methodist Church to replace the old chapel in Goudhurst Road. The Minister, Rev. R. Bradshaw, lives in Southborough
